metadata.name: Prism
metadata.description:
Prism, 2022, stop motion animation. 

How do you measure the space between Selves? 
This stop motion animation, from Cc & Juni, assembles our two figures in daytime afterglow — through a prism of skin and sky and parts diffusing. Glitching in and out of frame, they fracture and recombine. CC’s identity as a nonbinary femme embraces Juni’s trans femininity in a caress of contrast. Their conjoined forms stand tall, cut out from the void, in the halo of a backdrop both unreal, and surreal — effervescent, technicolor, vaporized. Where does the spirit really congeal?

“Prism” is a statement of queerness, identity, and singularity; of everything and nothing.

Medium: stop motion animation, blue body paint, digital collage, poster paper, self portrait photography 

Models: CC in the blue, Juni in the flesh. 

---  
Cc & Juni are Asian diaspora artists from Oakland. Together, with their ongoing 1:1 Phase Change series on Foundation, they form a Web3 collective. Their self-portrait work represents the amalgam of two queer femme bodies colliding in time & space, both on and off the Metaverse. 

Cc: Ann Li (Twitter: @play_w_cc Instagram: @play_w_cc) is a nonbinary self-portrait photographer & digital-media performance artist. Their work interrogates late-stage capitalism & social media culture from its own terrain. They/she grew up Chinese-American on the east coast.

Juniper Yun (Twitter: @tygrpuppy Instagram: @tigerrabbittiger) is a South-Korean born, Oakland-based visual artist & writer whose work explores themes of identity, desire, & transformation. As a trans WOC, she uplifts & supports her communities.

 ©2022 Cc & Juni
